channel.title: Resources on Graham Montgomery

item.title: Insect families of the US & Canada
item.description: This is a list of all the insect families found in the United States and Canada, organized by order, and curated by GM. If you find any errors, please contact GM at montgomery.graham AT gmail.com. Taxonomic authorities used as references for this list can be found at the bottom of the page. Order Family Common name Archaeognatha Machilidae Jumping bristletails Archaeognatha Meinertellidae Rock bristletails Zygentoma Lepidotrichidae Forest silverfish Zygentoma Lepismatidae True silverfish** Zygentoma Nicoletiidae Subterranean silverfish Ephemeroptera Acanthametropodidae Sand-dwelling mayflies Ephemeroptera Ameletidae Comb-mouthed minnow mayflies* Ephemeroptera Ametropodidae Sand minnows Ephemeroptera Arthropleidae Flat-headed mayflies* Ephemeroptera Baetidae Small minnow mayflies Ephemeroptera Baetiscidae Armored mayflies Ephemeroptera Behningiidae Tuskless burrower mayflies Ephemeroptera Caenidae Small square-gilled mayflies* Ephemeroptera Ephemerellidae Spiny crawler mayflies Ephemeroptera Ephemeridae Common burrower mayflies Ephemeroptera Euthyplociidae n/a Ephemeroptera Heptageniidae Flat-headed mayflies* Ephemeroptera Isonychiidae Brush-legged mayflies* Ephemeroptera Leptohyphidae Little stout crawler mayflies Ephemeroptera Leptophlebiidae Prong-gilled mayflies* Ephemeroptera Metretopodidae Cleft-footed minnow mayflies Ephemeroptera Neoephemeridae Large square-gilled mayflies* Ephemeroptera Oligoneuriidae Brush-legged mayflies* Ephemeroptera Palingeniidae Spiny-headed burrower mayflies* Ephemeroptera Polymitarcyidae Pale burrower mayflies Ephemeroptera Potamanthidae Hacklegill mayflies Ephemeroptera Pseudironidae Crabwalker mayflies Ephemeroptera Siphlonuridae Primitive minnow mayflies Odonata Aeshnidae Darners Odonata Calopterygidae Broad-winged damselflies Odonata Coenagrionidae Narrow-winged damselflies Odonata Cordulegastridae Spiketails; Biddies Odonata Corduliidae Emeralds; Green-eyed skimmers Odonata Gomphidae Clubtails Odonata Lestidae Spreadwings; Stalked-winged damselflies Odonata Libellulidae Skimmers Odonata Macromiidae Cruisers; Belted skimmers Odonata Petaluridae Petaltails; Graybacks Odonata Protoneuridae Threadtails; tropical damselflies Zoraptera Zorotypidae Angel insects Dermaptera Anisolabididae n/a Dermaptera Forficulidae Common earwigs Dermaptera Labiduridae Long-horned earwigs; striped earwigs Dermaptera Spongiphoridae Little earwigs Plecoptera Capniidae Small winter stoneflies Plecoptera Chloroperlidae Green stoneflies Plecoptera Leuctridae Rolled-winged stoneflies Plecoptera Nemouridae Spring stoneflies Plecoptera Peltoperlidae Roach-like stoneflies Plecoptera Perlidae Common stoneflies Plecoptera Perlodidae Predatory stoneflies Plecoptera Pteronarcyidae Giant stoneflies Plecoptera Taeniopterygidae Winter stoneflies Orthoptera Acrididae Short-horned grasshoppers Orthoptera Anostostomatidae Wetas & King crickets; Silk-spinning crickets Orthoptera Eumastacidae Monkey grasshoppers Orthoptera Gryllacrididae Raspy crickets; Leaf-rolling crickets Orthoptera Gryllidae True crickets Orthoptera Gryllotalpidae Mole crickets Orthoptera Mogoplistidae Scaly crickets Orthoptera Myrmecophilidae Ant crickets Orthoptera Oecanthidae Tree crickets Orthoptera Prophalangopsidae Hump-winged crickets; Grigs Orthoptera Rhaphidophoridae Camel crickets Orthoptera Ripipterygidae Mud crickets Orthoptera Romaleidae Lubber grasshoppers Orthoptera Stenopelmatidae Jerusalem crickets Orthoptera Tanaoceridae Desert long-horned grasshoppers Orthoptera Tetrigidae Pygmy grasshoppers; grouse locusts; groundhoppers Orthoptera Tettigoniidae Katydids Orthoptera Tridactylidae Pygmy mole crickets Orthoptera Trigonidiidae Ground crickets/Wood crickets & Sword-tail crickets (Ground crickets & allies?

item.title: Recommended ID resources
item.description: My preferred comprehensive ID resources for North America north of Mexico* Butterflies | A Swift Guide to Butterflies of North America by Glassberg Tiger beetles | A Field Guide to the Tiger Beetles of the United States and Canada by Pearson, et al. Dragonflies | Dragonflies and Damselflies of the East (and the western edition) by Paulson Bumblebees | Bumble Bees of North America: An Identification Guide by Williams et al.
